document_data.name: Dragon Boat Festival
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite dragon/130/The Oriental Sea|68}}{{Cite dungeon/8/The Flowers of Flame|47}}<ref group="note" name="power">This festival is most likely derived from the [[Wikipedia:Dragon Boat Festival|festival of the same name]] that is annually celebrated in [[Wikipedia:China|China]] on the 5{{th}} day of the 5{{th}} month. As per the name of the festival, it most likely involved the racing of [[dragon boat]]s.<ref group="note" name="date">While the specific day on which the Dragon Boat Festival takes place is not mentioned in any source, a rough estimate can be extrapolated from the adventure [[dungeon magazine 8/The Flowers of Flame|The Flowers of Flame]]. In that adventure, it is stated to start on the 3{{rd}} day of Ju and that the festival is ninety days away. Adding up the remaining days of Ju, as well as the 30 day periods of [[Yu (month)|Yu]] and [[Kao]], we can come to the conclusion that the festival would fall on the 3{{rd}} day of Kao II.
document_data.History: At some point in the early 14{{th}} century [[DR]], on the 3{{rd}} day of [[Ju]], the Shou governor [[Chan Sung Yu]] sent a group of [[adventurer]]s up into the [[Wu Pi Te Shao Mountains]] in search of the legendary ''[[Flowers of Flame]]''. The governor instructed them to leave the next day and to try to return before the Dragon Boat Festival, which at that point was 90 days away.
